title: Who Are the Hostages Believed Alive in Gaza?
summary: Israel says 20 living hostages are held by Hamas, set for release in a prisoner exchange together with the remains of those who died. Here’s what we know about them.

title: JB Pritzker Has Had It With Democrats Who Won’t Stand Up to Trump
summary: The Illinois governor, a potential presidential candidate, is fighting the presence of National Guard troops and the activities of ICE agents in Chicago.

title: Oklahoma’s Republican Governor Criticizes National Guard Deployment in Chicago
summary: Gov. Kevin Stitt, the current chairman of the National Governors Association, broke with Texas, saying, “Oklahomans would lose their mind” if Illinois sent troops to their red state.

title: Trump Fires Black Officials From an Overwhelmingly White Administration
summary: Separately, in the administration’s first 200 days, only two of 98 Senate-confirmed appointees to the most senior jobs in government were Black.

title: Who Can Afford Three Kids in New York City?
summary: The number of city households with three or more children has dropped by nearly 17 percent over the past decade as families struggle with the cost of child care and rent.

title: New York City: Where Street Parking Is Free, but Comes at a Cost
summary: After a TikTok video of a woman charging to “car sit” gained attention, New Yorkers were reminded that the price of street parking is rarely paid at a meter.

title: Laszlo Krasznahorkai Is Awarded Nobel Prize in Literature
summary: ​The prize committee said the Hungarian writer’s work “reaffirms the power of art.”

title: Government Shutdown Scrambles Some Home Sales in Flood Zones
summary: When the government shut down, so did the federal flood insurance program, forcing some buyers into the costly private market.

title: Thomas Pynchon Saw Where We Were Headed. How Does “Shadow Ticket” Hold Up?
summary: The novelist anticipated our bizarre present. How does his latest book hold up in an age of eroding reality?

title: Katie Porter Goes Viral for ‘Unhappy’ TV Interview in California Governor’s Race
summary: The former Democratic congresswoman, known for her own grilling of executives on Capitol Hill, threatened to abandon an interview after she was asked several follow-up questions.

title: 10 Months Later, Russia Admits Deadly Downing of Azerbaijani Plane
summary: President Vladimir Putin’s rare acknowledgment of a Russian military mistake came as relations have deteriorated between the two former Soviet states.

title: Modi Rosenfeld Is Gay. He’s Religious. His Comedy Career Is Booming.
summary: Mordechi Rosenfeld, known as Modi, already has the synagogue crowd. Now he wants the “Goyim, gays and theys,” too.

title: Oscar S. Wyatt Jr., Wily Texas Oilman, Is Dead at 101
summary: He made billions selling energy with his Coastal Corporation, courted presidents and dictators, and eventually went to prison for paying kickbacks to the Iraqi government.

title: Number of Children Fleeing Violence in Haiti Soars
summary: Haitian children face intensifying problems of crime, hunger and homelessness as the country’s humanitarian crisis shows no signs of easing, a report from a U.N. agency found.

title: We Have a Cease-Fire. Now the Middle East Needs Leadership.
summary: Promises of peace between Jews and Palestinians must be turned into reality.

title: He Believes America Should Be a Theocracy. He Says His Influence Is Growing.
summary: Doug Wilson’s political project to “stop making God angry.”

title: A Gaza Deal
summary: The world is waking up to an agreement between Israel and Hamas. We explain what we know about the breakthrough.

title: Another Guilty Verdict After Appeal in Gisèle Pelicot Rape Case
summary: One of the dozens of men convicted of raping Gisèle Pelicot appealed his verdict, but a French court again found him guilty.

title: In N.J. Governor’s Race, Energy Costs Have Become a Central Issue
summary: Energy costs have become a central issue in the governor’s race between Jack Ciattarelli, the Republican, and Representative Mikie Sherrill, the Democrat.

title: Chinese Surgeons Perform First Pig-to-Human Liver Transplant
summary: The transplanted portion of the genetically modified pig liver was removed after 38 days, and the patient, who had advanced liver cancer and cirrhosis, died several months later.

title: Irish Factory Prospered Because of China’s Babies. Then Nestlé Pulled the Plug.
summary: China’s baby boom enriched a small Irish town where a Nestlé factory made formula for Chinese newborns. Then a baby bust unraveled it all. Or so it seemed.
